blocks.content: Function returning the subspace topology induced by the topology ` y ` and the set ` x ` . (Contributed by FL, 20-Sep-2010.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 1-May-2015.)

blocks.name: df-topn
blocks.content: Define the topology extractor function. This differs from ~ df-tset when a structure has been restricted using ~ df-ress ; in this case the ` TopSet ` component will still have a topology over the larger set, and this function fixes this by restricting the topology as well. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: restfn
blocks.content: The subspace topology operator is a function on pairs. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm restfn() {
  |- wfn(crest, cxp(universe, universe))
} = {
  fnmpt2i(hs0, hs1, crest, universe, universe, crn(cmpt(hs2, cv(hs0), cin(cv(hs2), cv(hs1)))))
  df-rest(hs0, hs1, hs2)
  rnex(cmpt(hs2, cv(hs0), cin(cv(hs2), cv(hs1))))
  mptex(hs2, cv(hs0), cin(cv(hs2), cv(hs1)))
  vex(hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs1.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs2.c(cv(hs0))
}

blocks.name: restval
blocks.content: The subspace topology induced by the topology ` J ` on the set ` A ` . (Contributed by FL, 20-Sep-2010.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 1-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm restval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(co(c0, crest, c2), crn(cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  syl2an(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(co(c0, crest, c2), crn(cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2)))), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe))
  elex(c0, c1)
  elex(c2, c3)
  mpd3an3(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe), wceq(co(c0, crest, c2), crn(cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2)))), wcel(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2))), universe))
  adantr(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2))), universe))
  syl(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2))), universe), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2)), universe))
  mptexg(s0, c0, universe, cin(cv(s0), c2))
  rnexg(cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2)), universe)
  ovmpt2ga(hs0, hs1, c0, universe, c2, universe, crn(cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2))), universe, crest, crn(cmpt(s0, cv(hs0), cin(cv(s0), cv(hs1)))))
  rneqd(cmpt(s0, cv(hs0), cin(cv(s0), cv(hs1))), cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2)), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  mpteq12dv(s0, cv(hs0), cin(cv(s0), cv(hs1)), c0, cin(cv(s0), c2), wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  simpl(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))
  ineq2d(cv(s0), cv(hs1), c2, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)))
  simpr(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))
  df-rest(hs0, hs1, s0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2))))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(universe)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(crn(cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2))))
  diff.wa.s(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs1), c2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
}

  âŠ¢ ((c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c2 âˆˆ c3)â†’(c0[|`t]c2)= ran((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(s0 â‹‚ c2))))
  âŠ£ d(s0, c0)

  adantr(c0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, c2 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, ran((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(s0 â‹‚ c2)))âˆˆ ğ•Œ)
  syl(c0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, ran((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(s0 â‹‚ c2)))âˆˆ ğ•Œ, (s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(s0 â‹‚ c2))âˆˆ ğ•Œ)
  mptexg(s0, c0, universe, (s0 â‹‚ c2))
  rnexg((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(s0 â‹‚ c2)), universe)
  ovmpt2ga(hs0, hs1, c0, universe, c2, universe, ran((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(s0 â‹‚ c2))), universe, crest, ran((s0 âˆˆ hs0 â†¦(s0 â‹‚ hs1))))
  rneqd((s0 âˆˆ hs0 â†¦(s0 â‹‚ hs1)), (s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(s0 â‹‚ c2)), (hs0 = c0 âˆ§ hs1 = c2))
  mpteq12dv(s0, hs0, (s0 â‹‚ hs1), c0, (s0 â‹‚ c2), (hs0 = c0 âˆ§ hs1 = c2))

  ineq2d(s0, hs1, c2, (hs0 = c0 âˆ§ hs1 = c2))
  simpr(hs0 = c0, hs1 = c2)
  df-rest(hs0, hs1, s0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(ran((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(s0 â‹‚ c2))))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(universe)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(ran((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(s0 â‹‚ c2))))
  diff.wa.s(s0, hs0 = c0, hs1 = c2)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs1, c2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: elrest
blocks.content: The predicate "is an open set of a subspace topology". (Contributed by FL, 5-Jan-2009.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Dec-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm elrest(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wb(wcel(c4, co(c0, crest, c2)), wrex(s0, c0, wceq(c4, cin(cv(s0), c2)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  syl6bb(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c4, co(c0, crest, c2)), wrex(s0, c0, wceq(c4, cin(cv(s0), c2))), wcel(c4, crn(cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2)))))
  eleq2d(c4, co(c0, crest, c2), crn(cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)))
  restval(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3)
  elrnmpti(s0, c4, cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2)), c0, cin(cv(s0), c2))
  eqid(cmpt(s0, c0, cin(cv(s0), c2)))
  inex1(cv(s0), c2)
  vex(s0)
}

thm elrest(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  âŠ¢ ((c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c2 âˆˆ c3)â†’(c4 âˆˆ(c0[|`t]c2)â†” âˆƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, c4 =(s0 â‹‚ c2))))
  âŠ£ d(s0, c0)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c2)
  âŠ£ d(s0, c4)
} = {
  syl6bb((c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c2 âˆˆ c3), c4 âˆˆ(c0[|`t]c2), âˆƒ(s0 âˆˆ c0, c4 =(s0 â‹‚ c2)), c4 âˆˆ ran((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(s0 â‹‚ c2))))
  eleq2d(c4, (c0[|`t]c2), ran((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(s0 â‹‚ c2))), (c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c2 âˆˆ c3))
  restval(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3)

  eqid((s0 âˆˆ c0 â†¦(s0 â‹‚ c2)))
  inex1(s0, c2)
  vex(s0)
}

blocks.name: elrestr
blocks.content: Sufficient condition for being an open set in a subspace. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 11-Jul-2009.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Dec-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm elrestr(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c0)), wcel(cin(c4, c2), co(c0, crest, c2)))
} = {
  3impia(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c0), wcel(cin(c4, c2), co(c0, crest, c2)))
  syl5ibr(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c4, c0), wcel(cin(c4, c2), co(c0, crest, c2)), wrex(hs0, c0, wceq(cin(c4, c2), cin(cv(hs0), c2))))
  mpan2(wcel(c4, c0), wrex(hs0, c0, wceq(cin(c4, c2), cin(cv(hs0), c2))), wceq(cin(c4, c2), cin(c4, c2)))
  eqid(cin(c4, c2))
  rspceeqv(hs0, c4, c0, cin(c4, c2), cin(c4, c2), cin(cv(hs0), c2))
  ineq1(cv(hs0), c4, c2)
  elrest(hs0, c0, c1, c2, c3, cin(c4, c2))
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cin(c4, c2))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

  eqid((c4 â‹‚ c2))

}

blocks.name: 0rest
blocks.content: Value of the structure restriction when the topology input is empty. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm 0rest(class c0) {
  |- wceq(co(emptycls, crest, c0), emptycls)
} = {
  pm2.61i(wceq(co(emptycls, crest, c0), emptycls), wcel(c0, universe))
  syl6eq(co(emptycls, crest, c0), emptycls, crn(cmpt(hs0, emptycls, cin(cv(hs0), c0))), wcel(c0, universe))
  mpan(wcel(c0, universe), wceq(co(emptycls, crest, c0), crn(cmpt(hs0, emptycls, cin(cv(hs0), c0)))), wcel(emptycls, universe))
  0ex()
  restval(hs0, emptycls, universe, c0, universe)
  eqtri(crn(cmpt(hs0, emptycls, cin(cv(hs0), c0))), emptycls, crn(emptycls))
  rneqi(cmpt(hs0, emptycls, cin(cv(hs0), c0)), emptycls)
  mpt0(hs0, cin(cv(hs0), c0))
  rn0()
  ovprc2(c0, emptycls, crest)
  mpbir(wrel(cdm(crest)), wrel(cxp(universe, universe)))
  relxp(universe, universe)
  releqi(cdm(crest), cxp(universe, universe))
  ax-mp(wceq(cdm(crest), cxp(universe, universe)), wfn(crest, cxp(universe, universe)))
  restfn()
  fndm(crest, cxp(universe, universe))
  diff.hs0.c(emptycls)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}

blocks.name: restid2
blocks.content: The subspace topology over a subset of the base set is the original topology. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm restid2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cpw(c0))), wceq(co(c2, crest, c0), c2))
} = {
  eqtrd(co(c2, crest, c0), c2, crn(cmpt(hs0, c2, cin(cv(hs0), c0))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cpw(c0))))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cpw(c0))), wceq(co(c2, crest, c0), crn(cmpt(hs0, c2, cin(cv(hs0), c0)))), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c0, c1))
  ssexd(c2, cpw(c0), universe, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cpw(c0))))
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cpw(c0)), wcel(cpw(c0), universe))
  pwexg(c0, c1)
  simpl(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cpw(c0)))
  restval(hs0, c2, universe, c0, c1)
  syl6eq(crn(cmpt(hs0, c2, cin(cv(hs0), c0))), c2, crn(cres(cid, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cpw(c0))))
  rneqd(cmpt(hs0, c2, cin(cv(hs0), c0)), cres(cid, c2), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cpw(c0))))
  syl6eq(cmpt(hs0, c2, cin(cv(hs0), c0)), cres(cid, c2), cmpt(hs0, c2, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cpw(c0))))
  mpteq2dva(hs0, c2, cin(cv(hs0), c0), cv(hs0), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cpw(c0))))
  sylib(wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cpw(c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wceq(cin(cv(hs0), c0), cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), c0))
  elpwid(cv(hs0), c0, wa(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cpw(c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  sselda(cv(hs0), c2, cpw(c0), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cpw(c0))))
  simpr(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cpw(c0)))
  df-ss(cv(hs0), c0)
  mptresid(hs0, c2)
  rnresi(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c2, cpw(c0))))
}

  rneqd((hs0 âˆˆ c2 â†¦(hs0 â‹‚ c0)), (= |` c2), (c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c2 âŠ† P(c0)))
  syl6eq((hs0 âˆˆ c2 â†¦(hs0 â‹‚ c0)), (= |` c2), (hs0 âˆˆ c2 â†¦ hs0), (c0 âˆˆ c1 âˆ§ c2 âŠ† P(c0)))

  simpr(c0 âˆˆ c1, c2 âŠ† P(c0))
  df-ss(hs0, c0)

  rnresi(c2)

blocks.name: restsspw
blocks.content: The subspace topology is a collection of subsets of the restriction set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm restsspw(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wss(co(c0, crest, c1), cpw(c1))
} = {
  ssriv(hs0, co(c0, crest, c1), cpw(c1))
  sylibr(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, crest, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(c1)), wss(cv(hs0), c1))
  syl(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, crest, c1)), wss(cv(hs0), c1), wrex(hs1, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), cin(cv(hs1), c1))))
  ibi(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, crest, c1)), wrex(hs1, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), cin(cv(hs1), c1))))
  syl(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, crest, c1)), wb(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, crest, c1)), wrex(hs1, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), cin(cv(hs1), c1)))), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe)))
  nsyl2(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, crest, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c1, universe)), wceq(co(c0, crest, c1), emptycls))
  n0i(cv(hs0), co(c0, crest, c1))
  ndmov(c0, universe, c1, crest)
  ax-mp(wceq(cdm(crest), cxp(universe, universe)), wfn(crest, cxp(universe, universe)))
  restfn()
  fndm(crest, cxp(universe, universe))
  elrest(hs1, c0, universe, c1, universe, cv(hs0))
  rexlimivw(hs1, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), cin(cv(hs1), c1)), wss(cv(hs0), c1))
  mpbiri(wceq(cv(hs0), cin(cv(hs1), c1)), wss(cv(hs0), c1), wss(cin(cv(hs1), c1), c1))
  inss2(cv(hs1), c1)
  sseq1(cv(hs0), cin(cv(hs1), c1), c1)
  selpw(hs0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c0, crest, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(cpw(c1))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(cv(hs0))
  diff.hs1.w(wss(cv(hs0), c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
}

  oveq12d(cfv(cts, cv(hs0)), crest, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), c0, c1, wceq(cv(hs0), c2))

  syl6eqr(cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), c1, cfv(cbs, c2), wceq(cv(hs0), c2))

  ovex(c0, crest, c1)
  3eqtr4a(co(c0, crest, c1), cfv(ctopn, c2), co(emptycls, crest, c1), emptycls, wn(wcel(c2, universe)))
  0rest(c1)
  oveq1d(c0, crest, c1, emptycls, wn(wcel(c2, universe)))
  syl5eq(c0, emptycls, cfv(cts, c2), wn(wcel(c2, universe)))

  diff.hs0.c(c2)

}

blocks.name: topnpropd
blocks.content: The topology extractor function depends only on the base and topology components. (Contributed by NM, 18-Jul-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm topnpropd(class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(ctopn, c0), cfv(ctopn, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(cbs, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cts, c0), cfv(cts, c1)))
} = {
  3eqtr3g(cfv(ctopn, c0), cfv(ctopn, c1), co(cfv(cts, c0), crest, cfv(cbs, c0)), co(cfv(cts, c1), crest, cfv(cbs, c1)), w0)
  oveq12d(cfv(cts, c0), crest, cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(cts, c1), cfv(cbs, c1), w0)
  topnval(cfv(cts, c0), cfv(cbs, c0), c0)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cts, c0))
  topnval(cfv(cts, c1), cfv(cbs, c1), c1)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cts, c1))
}

}

blocks.name: df-gsum
blocks.content: Define the group sum for the structure ` G ` of a finite sequence of elements whose values are defined by the expression ` B ` and whose set of indices is ` A ` . It may be viewed as a product (if ` G ` is a multiplication), a sum (if ` G ` is an addition) or any other operation. The variable ` k ` is normally a free variable in ` B ` (i.e., ` B ` can be thought of as ` B ( k ) ` ). The definition is meaningful in different contexts, depending on the size of the index set ` A ` and each demanding different properties of ` G ` . 1. If ` A = (/) ` and ` G ` has an identity element, then the sum equals this identity. 2. If ` A = ( M ... N ) ` and ` G ` is any magma, then the sum is the sum of the elements, evaluated left-to-right, i.e. ` ( B ( 1 ) + B ( 2 ) ) + B ( 3 ) ` etc. 3. If ` A ` is a finite set (or is nonzero for finitely many indices) and ` G ` is a commutative monoid, then the sum adds up these elements in some order, which is then uniquely defined. 4. If ` A ` is an infinite set and ` G ` is a Hausdorff topological group, then there is a meaningful sum, but ` gsum ` cannot handle this case. See ~ df-tsms . Remark: this definition is required here because the symbol ` gsum ` is already used in ~ df-prds and ~ df-imas . The related theorems are provided later, see ~ gsumvalx . (Contributed by FL, 5-Sep-2010.) (Revised by FL, 17-Oct-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 7-Dec-2014.)

blocks.name: df-topgen
blocks.content: Define a function that converts a basis to its corresponding topology. Equivalent to the definition of a topology generated by a basis in [Munkres] p. 78 (see ~ tgval2 ). The first use of this definition is ~ tgval but the token is used in ~ df-pt . See ~ tgval3 for an alternate expression for the value. (Contributed by NM, 16-Jul-2006.)

blocks.name: df-pt

df-prds
blocks.content: Define a structure product. This can be a product of groups, rings, modules, or ordered topological fields; any unused components will have garbage in them but this is usually not relevant for the purpose of inheriting the structures present in the factors. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 3-Jan-2015.) (Revised by Thierry Arnoux, 15-Jun-2019.)

  |- wbr(c0, cstr, cop(nat1, cdc(nat1, nat2)))

thm prdsle(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, copab(s0, s1, wa(wss(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), c1), wral(s2, c2, wbr(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cfv(cple, cfv(c3, cv(s2))), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))))
  -| wceq(c4, co(c5, cprds, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c7))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cdm(c3), c2))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cple, c4))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c4)
  -| diffsc(s2, c5)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)

blocks.name: prdsdsfn
blocks.content: Structure product distance function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Sep-2015.)

thm prdsdsfn(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wfn(c0, cxp(c1, c1)))
  -| wceq(c2, co(c3, cprds, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c6))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cdm(c4), c7))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cds, c2))
} = {
  mpbiri(w0, wfn(c0, cxp(c1, c1)), wfn(cmpo(hs0, hs1, c1, c1, csup(cun(crn(cmpt(hs2, c7, co(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(cds, cfv(c4, cv(hs2))), cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))), csn(nat0)), cxr, clt)), cxp(c1, c1)))
  fnmpt2i(hs0, hs1, cmpo(hs0, hs1, c1, c1, csup(cun(crn(cmpt(hs2, c7, co(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(cds, cfv(c4, cv(hs2))), cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))), csn(nat0)), cxr, clt)), c1, c1, csup(cun(crn(cmpt(hs2, c7, co(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(cds, cfv(c4, cv(hs2))), cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))), csn(nat0)), cxr, clt))
  eqid(cmpo(hs0, hs1, c1, c1, csup(cun(crn(cmpt(hs2, c7, co(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(cds, cfv(c4, cv(hs2))), cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))), csn(nat0)), cxr, clt)))
  supex(cun(crn(cmpt(hs2, c7, co(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(cds, cfv(c4, cv(hs2))), cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))), csn(nat0)), cxr, clt)
  xrltso()
  fneq1d(c0, cxp(c1, c1), cmpo(hs0, hs1, c1, c1, csup(cun(crn(cmpt(hs2, c7, co(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(cds, cfv(c4, cv(hs2))), cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))), csn(nat0)), cxr, clt)), w0)
  prdsds(hs0, hs1, hs2, c0, c1, c7, c4, c2, c3, c5, c6, w0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(c7)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs1.c(c7)
  diff.hs1.c(c4)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c3)
  diff.hs2.c(c1)
  diff.hs2.c(c7)
  diff.hs2.c(c4)
  diff.hs2.c(c2)
  diff.hs2.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs1.w(w0)
  diff.hs2.w(w0)
}

thm prdshom(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, cmpo(s0, s1, c1, c1, cixp(s2, c2, co(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cfv(chom, cfv(c3, cv(s2))), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))))
  -| wceq(c4, co(c5, cprds, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c7))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c4))

  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)

blocks.name: prdsbas2
blocks.content: The base set of a structure product is an indexed set product. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 10-Jan-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm prdsbas2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, cixp(s0, c1, cfv(cbs, cfv(c2, cv(s0))))))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c4, cprds, c2))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wfn(c2, c1))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wceq(c0, cixp(s0, c1, cfv(cbs, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))))), diffsc(s0, c5))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wceq(c0, cixp(s0, c1, cfv(cbs, cfv(c2, cv(s0)))))), diffsc(s0, c6))
  prdsbas(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, universe, w0)
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(c2, universe), wfn(c2, c1), wcel(c1, c6))
  fnex(c2, c1, c6)
  syl(w0, wceq(cdm(c2), c1), wfn(c2, c1))
  fndm(c2, c1)
}

} = {
  bitrd(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), c2), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, cfv(c3, cv(s0))))), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cixp(s0, c0, cfv(cbs, cfv(c3, cv(s0))))))
